body.p: Configuration stream holds the field name mapping configuration. The field name mapping is read into the database and taken into use when the Configuration stream is started for the first time.

Field name mapping is used for optimizing the storage space needed for records in the database. The field names in both input and output records are mapped to a shorter character representation and the mapping is available to all nodes reading from or writing to the database.

The field name mapping can be updated in new versions of the CDR streams. In that case the new field name mappings are taken into use when running the new version of the CG Configuration Node for the first time in publish mode.
